title: Authors and Citation
text: Jasen Finch. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Finch J (2023). hrmtargets: Targets high resolution metabolomics workflows. R package version 0.1.0, https://jasenfinch.github.io/hrmtargets/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {hrmtargets: Targets for high resolution metabolomics workflows},   author = {Jasen Finch},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://jasenfinch.github.io/hrmtargets/}, }

what: Targets for high resolution metabolomics workflows
title: Targets for high resolution metabolomics workflows
text: Targets high resolution metabolomics workflows

title: Targets for high resolution metabolomics workflows
text: can install development version hrmtargets GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("jasenfinch/hrmtargets")

title: Consensus structural classifications — tar_construction
text: Targets consensus structural classification

title: Consensus structural classifications — tar_construction
code: tar_construction(   name,   x = NULL,   library_path = "data/structural_classifications",   db = "kegg",   organism = character(),   threshold = 50,   classyfireR_cache = "data/structural_classifications/classyfireR_cache.db",   summary = TRUE,   export_path = "exports/structural_classifications" )

title: Consensus structural classifications — tar_construction
text: name Symbol. name collection targets. serves prefix target names. x S4 object class Assignment.  NULL, target input expected existing target. See details. library_path target file path classification library store consensus classification data db databases search. can either kegg /pubchem. organism KEGG organism ID. Ignored argument db set pubchem threshold percentage majority threshold consensus classification classyfireR_cache file path classyfireR cache. See documentation classyfireR::get_classification details. summary Boolean. Include additional summary targets. export_path Destination path export files. Set NULL skip exports.

title: Consensus structural classifications — tar_construction
text: list target objects consensus structural classifications.

title: Consensus structural classifications — tar_construction
text: Specifying argument x NULL enables use input tar_mf_assignment() target factory, See second example .

title: Consensus structural classifications — tar_construction
code: if (FALSE) { ## Perform consensus structural classification by specifying assignments directly targets::tar_dir({     targets::tar_script({         library(hrmtargets)                  mf_assignments <- assignments::assignMFs(             assignments::feature_data,             parameters = assignments::assignmentParameters('FIE-HRMS')         )                  list(             tar_construction(assignments::feature_data)         )     })     targets::tar_make()     targets::tar_read(example_summary_construction) })  ## Perform consensus structural classification by using inputs from other target factories. targets::tar_dir({     targets::tar_script({         library(hrmtargets)         name <- rlang::expr(example)                  list(             tar_input_piggyback(!!name,                                 'FIE-HRMS_BdistachyonTechnical',                                 repo = 'jasenfinch/metaboData'),             tar_spectral_binning(!!name),             tar_pre_treatment(!!name),             tar_mf_assignment(!!name),             tar_construction(!!name)         )     })     targets::tar_make()     targets::tar_read(example_summary_construction) }) }

what: Dynamic branching over exported files — tar_export_raw
title: Dynamic branching over exported files — tar_export_raw
text: Dynamic branching exported files. similar functionality tarchetypes::tar_files() except upstream target automatically become invalidated time pipeline run.

title: Dynamic branching over exported files — tar_export_raw
code: tar_export_raw(   name,   command,   tidy_eval = targets::tar_option_get("tidy_eval"),   packages = targets::tar_option_get("packages"),   library = targets::tar_option_get("library"),   format = c("file", "url", "aws_file"),   repository = targets::tar_option_get("repository"),   iteration = targets::tar_option_get("iteration"),   error = targets::tar_option_get("error"),   memory = targets::tar_option_get("memory"),   garbage_collection = targets::tar_option_get("garbage_collection"),   deployment = targets::tar_option_get("deployment"),   priority = targets::tar_option_get("priority"),   resources = targets::tar_option_get("resources"),   storage = targets::tar_option_get("storage"),   retrieval = targets::tar_option_get("retrieval"),   cue = targets::tar_option_get("cue") )  tar_export(   name,   command,   tidy_eval = targets::tar_option_get("tidy_eval"),   packages = targets::tar_option_get("packages"),   library = targets::tar_option_get("library"),   format = c("file", "url", "aws_file"),   repository = targets::tar_option_get("repository"),   iteration = targets::tar_option_get("iteration"),   error = targets::tar_option_get("error"),   memory = targets::tar_option_get("memory"),   garbage_collection = targets::tar_option_get("garbage_collection"),   deployment = targets::tar_option_get("deployment"),   priority = targets::tar_option_get("priority"),   resources = targets::tar_option_get("resources"),   storage = targets::tar_option_get("storage"),   retrieval = targets::tar_option_get("retrieval"),   cue = targets::tar_option_get("cue") )

title: Dynamic branching over exported files — tar_export_raw
text: name Symbol, name target. target name must valid name symbol R, must start dot. Subsequent targets can refer name symbolically induce dependency relationship: e.g. tar_target(downstream_target, f(upstream_target)) target named downstream_target depends target upstream_target function f(). addition, target's name determines random number generator seed. way, target runs reproducible seed someone else running pipeline get results, two targets pipeline share seed. (Even dynamic branches different names thus different seeds.) can recover seed completed target tar_meta(your_target, seed) run set.seed() result locally recreate target's initial RNG state. command R code run target. tidy_eval Logical, whether enable tidy evaluation interpreting command pattern. TRUE, can use "bang-bang" operator !! programmatically insert values global objects. packages Character vector packages load right target builds output data reloaded downstream targets. Use tar_option_set() set packages globally subsequent targets define. library Character vector library paths try loading packages. format Character length 1. Must "file", "url", "aws_file". See format argument targets::tar_target() details. repository Character length 1, remote repository target storage. Choices: "local": file system local machine. "aws": Amazon Web Services (AWS) S3 bucket. Can configured non-AWS S3 bucket using endpoint argument tar_resources_aws(), versioning capabilities may lost . See cloud storage section https://books.ropensci.org/targets/data.html details instructions. "gcp": Google Cloud Platform storage bucket. See cloud storage section https://books.ropensci.org/targets/data.html details instructions. Note: repository "local" format "file" target create single output file. output file uploaded cloud tracked changes exists cloud. local file deleted target runs. iteration Character length 1, name iteration mode target. Choices: "vector": branching happens vctrs::vec_slice() aggregation happens vctrs::vec_c(). "list", branching happens [[]] aggregation happens list(). "group": dplyr::group_by()-like functionality branch subsets data frame. target's return value must data frame special tar_group column consecutive integers 1 number groups. integer designates group, branch created collection rows group. See tar_group() function see can create special tar_group column dplyr::group_by(). error Character length 1, target stops throws error. Options: "stop": whole pipeline stops throws error. "continue": whole pipeline keeps going. "abridge": currently running targets keep running, new targets launch . (Visit https://books.ropensci.org/targets/debugging.html learn debug targets using saved workspaces.) "null": errored target continues returns NULL. data hash deliberately wrong target date next run pipeline. memory Character length 1, memory strategy. "persistent", target stays memory end pipeline (unless storage "worker", case targets unloads value memory right storing order avoid sending copious data network). "transient", target gets unloaded every new target completes. Either way, target gets automatically loaded memory whenever another target needs value. cloud-based dynamic files (e.g. format = "file" repository = "aws"), memory strategy applies temporary local copy file: "persistent" means remains end pipeline deleted, "transient" means gets deleted soon possible. former conserves bandwidth, latter conserves local storage. garbage_collection Logical, whether run base::gc() just target runs. deployment Character length 1, relevant tar_make_clustermq() tar_make_future(). "worker", target builds parallel worker. "main", target builds host machine / process managing pipeline. priority Numeric length 1 0 1. Controls targets get deployed first multiple competing targets ready simultaneously. Targets priorities closer 1 get built earlier (polled earlier tar_make_future()). resources Object returned tar_resources() optional settings high-performance computing functionality, alternative data storage formats, optional capabilities targets. See tar_resources() details. storage Character length 1, relevant tar_make_clustermq() tar_make_future(). Must one following values: "main": target's return value sent back host machine saved/uploaded locally. "worker": worker saves/uploads value. "none": almost never recommended. niche situations, e.g. data needs loaded explicitly another language. use , return value target totally ignored target ends, downstream target still attempts load data file (except retrieval = "none"). select storage = "none", return value target's command ignored, data saved automatically. dynamic files (format = "file") responsibility user write data store inside target. distinguishing feature storage = "none" (opposed format = "file") general case, downstream targets automatically try load data data store dependency. corollary, storage = "none" completely unnecessary format "file". retrieval Character length 1, relevant tar_make_clustermq() tar_make_future(). Must one following values: "main": target's dependencies loaded host machine sent worker target builds. "worker": worker loads targets dependencies. "none": dependencies loaded . choice almost never recommended. niche situations, e.g. data needs loaded explicitly another language. cue optional object tar_cue() customize rules decide whether target date. applies downstream target. upstream target always runs.

title: Dynamic branching over exported files — tar_export_raw
text: list target objects exporting data files.

title: Dynamic branching over exported files — tar_export_raw
code: ## File export targets::tar_dir({     targets::tar_script({         library(hrmtargets)              list(             tar_export(                 example_export,                 jfmisc::exportCSV(iris,'iris.csv')             )         )     })     targets::tar_make()     targets::tar_read(example_export) }) #> • start target example_export_files #> • built target example_export_files [2.373 seconds] #> • start branch example_export_cc991457 #> • built branch example_export_cc991457 [0 seconds] #> • built pattern example_export #> • end pipeline [2.444 seconds] #>  #> example_export_cc991457  #>              "iris.csv"

what: Workflow input using file paths — tar_input_file_path
title: Workflow input using file paths — tar_input_file_path
text: Targets workflow inputs using file paths

title: Workflow input using file paths — tar_input_file_path
code: tar_input_file_path(name, mzML_files, sample_info)

title: Workflow input using file paths — tar_input_file_path
text: name Symbol. name collection targets. serves prefix target names. mzML_files characer vector mzML file paths. sample_info tibble containing sample information. See details specifications.

title: Workflow input using file paths — tar_input_file_path
text: list target objects specifically analysis pipeline input using file paths.

title: Workflow input using file paths — tar_input_file_path
text: tibble containing sample information least contain following columns: fileOrder - numeric file order input files order alphabetically returned list.files(). injOrder - sample injection order MS analysis fileName - sample file name batch - analytical batch number block - randomised block number name - sample name class - sample class name file names contained within argument mzML_files match name order within fileName sample information column.

title: Workflow input using file paths — tar_input_file_path
code: ## File path input  targets::tar_dir({ targets::tar_script({     library(hrmtargets)     file_paths <- metaboData::filePaths('FIE-HRMS','UrineTechnical',ask = FALSE)     sample_info <- metaboData::runinfo('FIE-HRMS','UrineTechnical',ask = FALSE)          list(         tar_input_file_path(test,                             file_paths,                             sample_info)     ) }) targets::tar_make() }) #> FIE-HRMS UrineTechnical #> size: 12.5M #> • start target test_mzML_files #> • built target test_mzML_files [0.002 seconds] #> • start target test_sample_information #> • built target test_sample_information [0.001 seconds] #> • start branch test_mzML_3f27ec6d #> • built branch test_mzML_3f27ec6d [0.001 seconds] #> • start branch test_mzML_4ab8dcd7 #> • built branch test_mzML_4ab8dcd7 [0 seconds] #> • start branch test_mzML_a66a628e #> • built branch test_mzML_a66a628e [0.001 seconds] #> • start branch test_mzML_3948e8b7 #> • built branch test_mzML_3948e8b7 [0 seconds] #> • start branch test_mzML_f160fe11 #> • built branch test_mzML_f160fe11 [0.001 seconds] #> • start branch test_mzML_520039d6 #> • built branch test_mzML_520039d6 [0.001 seconds] #> • start branch test_mzML_e7d05c2d #> • built branch test_mzML_e7d05c2d [0 seconds] #> • start branch test_mzML_a2bee6bc #> • built branch test_mzML_a2bee6bc [0 seconds] #> • start branch test_mzML_7773970a #> • built branch test_mzML_7773970a [0 seconds] #> • start branch test_mzML_7c630941 #> • built branch test_mzML_7c630941 [0 seconds] #> • built pattern test_mzML #> • end pipeline [0.239 seconds] #>

what: Workflow input using a grover API — tar_input_grover
title: Workflow input using a grover API — tar_input_grover
text: Targets workflow inputs using grover API

title: Workflow input using a grover API — tar_input_grover
code: tar_input_grover(   name,   instrument,   experiment,   grover_client,   conversion_args = grover::conversionArgsPeakPick(),   data_dir = "data/mzML" )

title: Workflow input using a grover API — tar_input_grover
text: name Symbol. name collection targets. serves prefix target names. instrument grover API repository instrument name. experiment experiment name referring directory available grover API. grover_client S4 object class GroverClient specifying host details grover API. conversion_args file conversion arguments passed args argument grover::convertFile(). data_dir path directory output converted mzML files.

title: Workflow input using a grover API — tar_input_grover
text: list target objects specifically analysis pipeline input using specified grover API.

title: Workflow input using a grover API — tar_input_grover
code: ## Grover API input targets::tar_dir({ targets::tar_script({     library(hrmtargets)     list(         tar_input_grover(example,                          'an_instrument',                          'an_experiment',                          grover::grover('a_host',80,'1234')) ) }) targets::tar_manifest() }) #> # A tibble: 4 × 3 #>   name                           command                                 pattern #>   <chr>                          <chr>                                   <chr>   #> 1 example_raw_files              "grover::listRawFiles(new(\"GroverClie… NA      #> 2 example_raw_sample_information "grover::sampleInfo(new(\"GroverClient… map(ex… #> 3 example_mzML                   "grover::convertFile(new(\"GroverClien… map(ex… #> 4 example_sample_information     "metaboMisc::convertSampleInfo(example… NA

what: Workflow input from a GitHub release — tar_input_piggyback
title: Workflow input from a GitHub release — tar_input_piggyback
text: Targets workflow input mzML data files sample information stored GitHub release using piggyback R package.

title: Workflow input from a GitHub release — tar_input_piggyback
code: tar_input_piggyback(   name,   tag,   file = NULL,   dest = paste0("data/", tag),   sample_info_file = "runinfo.csv",   ext = ".mzML.gz",   repo = guess_repo(),   overwrite = TRUE,   ignore = "manifest.json",   use_timestamps = TRUE,   show_progress = TRUE,   .token = gh::gh_token() )

title: Workflow input from a GitHub release — tar_input_piggyback
text: name Symbol. name collection targets. serves prefix target names. tag tag GitHub release data attached. file name vector names files downloaded. NULL, assets attached release downloaded. dest directory destination downloaded release data. sample_info_file name file included release contains sample information. ext file extension converted (mzML) data files. repo Repository name format "owner/repo". Defaults guess_repo(). overwrite local files name overwritten? default TRUE. ignore list files ignore (downloading "" file=NULL). use_timestamps DEPRECATED. show_progress logical, show progress bar shown uploading? Defaults [interactive()] - can also set globally options("piggyback.verbose") .token GitHub authentication token, see [gh::gh_token()]

title: Workflow input from a GitHub release — tar_input_piggyback
text: list target objects specifically analysis pipeline input data retrieval using piggyback.

title: Workflow input from a GitHub release — tar_input_piggyback
code: if (FALSE) { ## Example piggyback input targets::tar_dir({     targets::tar_script({         library(hrmtargets)         list(             tar_input_piggyback(example,                                 'FIE-HRMS_BdistachyonTechnical',                                 repo = 'jasenfinch/metaboData')         )     })     targets::tar_make()     targets::tar_read(example_sample_information) }) }

title: Molecular formula assignment — tar_mf_assignment
text: Targets molecular formula assignment.

title: Molecular formula assignment — tar_mf_assignment
code: tar_mf_assignment(   name,   feature_data = NULL,   parameters = assignments::assignmentParameters("FIE"),   verbose = TRUE,   summary = TRUE,   export_path = "exports/molecular_formula_assignments" )

title: Molecular formula assignment — tar_mf_assignment
text: name Symbol. name collection targets. serves prefix target names. feature_data tibble containing feature intensity matrix assign molecular formulas. NULL, target input expected existing target. See details. parameters S4 object class AssignmentParameters. verbose Show assignment console output. summary Boolean. Include additional summary targets. export_path Destination path export files. Set NULL skip exports.

title: Molecular formula assignment — tar_mf_assignment
text: list target objects molecular formula assignment.

title: Molecular formula assignment — tar_mf_assignment
text: Specifying argument feature_data NULL enables use input tar_pre_treatment() target factory, See second example .

title: Molecular formula assignment — tar_mf_assignment
code: if (FALSE) { ## Perform molecular formula assignment by specifying the feature data directly targets::tar_dir({     targets::tar_script({         library(hrmtargets)                  list(             tar_mf_assignment(assignments::feature_data)         )     })     targets::tar_make()     targets::tar_read(example_summary_assignments) })  ## Perform molecular formula assignment by using `tar_input_piggyback()`, ## `tar_input_spectral_binning()` and `tar_pre_treatment()`  targets::tar_dir({     targets::tar_script({         library(hrmtargets)         name <- rlang::expr(example)                  list(             tar_input_piggyback(!!name,                                 'FIE-HRMS_BdistachyonTechnical',                                 repo = 'jasenfinch/metaboData'),             tar_spectral_binning(!!name),             tar_pre_treatment(!!name),             tar_mf_assignment(!!name)         )     })     targets::tar_make()     targets::tar_read(example_results_spectral_processing)     targets::tar_read(example_summary_assignments) }) }

what: Pre-treatment of spectrally processed data — tar_pre_treatment
title: Pre-treatment of spectrally processed data — tar_pre_treatment
text: Targets pre-treatment spectral processed data.

title: Pre-treatment of spectrally processed data — tar_pre_treatment
code: tar_pre_treatment(   name,   spectral_processed = NULL,   parameters = NULL,   cls = "class",   QCidx = "QC",   verbose = TRUE,   plots = c("PCA", "LDA", "unsupervised_RF", "supervised_RF"),   export_path = "exports/pre-treated" )

title: Pre-treatment of spectrally processed data — tar_pre_treatment
text: name Symbol. name collection targets. serves prefix target names. spectral_processed S4 object class Binalysis MetaboProfile. NULL, target input expected existing target. See details. parameters object S4 class AnalysisParameters containing pre-treatment parameters symbol containing name target use input parameters. NULL, metaboMisc::detectPretreatmentParameters() used detect pre-treatment parameters based cls argument. cls name sample information table column containing sample class information parameter detection plotting. Ignored parameters argument parameters NULL. QCidx QC sample class label. Ignored argument parameters NULL. verbose Show pre-treatment console output. plots character vector plot types. Set NULL skip plots. export_path Destination path export files. Set NULL skip exports.

title: Pre-treatment of spectrally processed data — tar_pre_treatment
text: list target objects processing mzML data files using spectral binning.

title: Pre-treatment of spectrally processed data — tar_pre_treatment
text: Specifying argument spectral_processed NULL enables use additional target factories outputing spectrally processed data. See examples .

title: Pre-treatment of spectrally processed data — tar_pre_treatment
code: if (FALSE) { ## Perform pre-treatment by specifying the spectrally processed data directly targets::tar_dir({     targets::tar_script({         library(hrmtargets)         file_paths <- metaboData::filePaths('FIE-HRMS','UrineTechnical',                                             ask = FALSE)         sample_info <- metaboData::runinfo('FIE-HRMS','UrineTechnical',                                            ask = FALSE)         spectral_processed <- binneR::binneRlyse(file_paths,                                                  sample_info,                                                  binneR::detectParameters(file_paths))                  list(             tar_pre_treatment(example,                               spectral_processed = spectral_processed)         )     })     targets::tar_make()     targets::tar_read(example_results_pre_treatment)     targets::tar_read(example_plot_PCA) })  ## Perform pre-treatment by combining the use of  ## `tar_input_piggyback()` and `tar_spectral_binning()`  targets::tar_dir({     targets::tar_script({         library(hrmtargets)         name <- rlang::expr(example)                  list(             tar_input_piggyback(!!name,                                 'FIE-HRMS_BdistachyonTechnical',                                 repo = 'jasenfinch/metaboData'),             tar_spectral_binning(!!name),             tar_pre_treatment(!!name)         )     })     targets::tar_make()     targets::tar_read(example_results_pre_treatment)     targets::tar_read(example_plot_PCA) }) }

what: Spectral processing for profiling data — tar_profiling
title: Spectral processing for profiling data — tar_profiling
text: Targets spectral processing profiling data.

title: Spectral processing for profiling data — tar_profiling
code: tar_profiling(   name,   technique,   mzML = NULL,   sample_info = NULL,   cls = "class",   parameters = NULL,   plots = c("chromatogram", "TIC"),   summary = TRUE,   export_path = "exports/spectral_processing" )

title: Spectral processing for profiling data — tar_profiling
text: name Symbol. name collection targets. serves prefix target names. technique profiling technique use. one values returned profilePro::availableTechniques(). mzML character vector mzML data file paths. NULL, target input expected existing target. See details. sample_info tibble containing sample information. See details specifications. NULL, target input expected existing target. See details. cls Sample information column use plotting. parameters S4 object class ProfileParameters. NULL, default parameters argument technique used. plots character vector plot types. Set NULL skip plots. summary Boolean. Include additional summary targets. export_path Destination path export files. Set NULL skip exports.

title: Spectral processing for profiling data — tar_profiling
text: list target objects processing mzML data files using profilePro.

title: Spectral processing for profiling data — tar_profiling
text: Specifying arguments mzML sample_info NULL enables use one data file sample information one input target factories, tar_input_file_path(), tar_input_grover() tar_input_piggyback(). See example using tar_input_piggyback() .

title: Spectral processing for profiling data — tar_profiling
code: if (FALSE) { ## Perform profiling processing by specifying the file paths and sample information directly targets::tar_dir({     targets::tar_script({         library(hrmtargets)         file_paths <- metaboData::filePaths('RP-UHPLC-HRMS','BdistachyonEcotypes',                                             ask = FALSE)         sample_info <- metaboData::runinfo('RP-UHPLC-HRMS','BdistachyonEcotypes',                                            ask = FALSE)                  list(             tar_profiling(example,                           technique = 'LCMS-RP',                           mzML = file_paths,                           sample_info = sample_info)         )     })     targets::tar_make()     targets::tar_read(example_results_spectral_processing)     targets::tar_read(example_plot_chromatogram) })  ## Perform spectral binning by using tar_input_piggyback()  targets::tar_dir({     targets::tar_script({         name <- rlang::expr(example)         library(hrmtargets)         file_paths <- metaboData::filePaths('RP-UHPLC-HRMS','BdistachyonEcotypes',                                             ask = FALSE)         sample_info <- metaboData::runinfo('RP-UHPLC-HRMS','BdistachyonEcotypes',                                            ask = FALSE)          list(             tar_input_file_path(!!name,                                 file_paths,                                 sample_info),             tar_profiling(!!name,                           'LCMS-RP')         )    })    targets::tar_make()    targets::tar_read(example_results_spectral_processing)    targets::tar_read(example_plot_chromatogram) }) }

what: Spectral processing using spectral binning — tar_spectral_binning
title: Spectral processing using spectral binning — tar_spectral_binning
text: Targets spectral processing FIE-HRMS data using spectral binning.

title: Spectral processing using spectral binning — tar_spectral_binning
code: tar_spectral_binning(   name,   mzML = NULL,   sample_info = NULL,   parameters = NULL,   plots = c("chromatogram", "fingerprint", "TIC", "purity_dist", "centrality_dist"),   verbose = TRUE,   summary = TRUE,   export_path = "exports/spectral_processing" )

title: Spectral processing using spectral binning — tar_spectral_binning
text: name Symbol. name collection targets. serves prefix target names. mzML character vector mzML data file paths. NULL, target input expected existing target. See details. sample_info tibble containing sample information. See details specifications. NULL, target input expected existing target. See details. parameters S4 object class BinParameters. NULL, binneR::detectParameters() used detect spectral binning parameters automatically.. plots character vector plot types. Set NULL skip plots. verbose Show spectral processing console output. summary Boolean. Include additional summary targets. export_path Destination path export files. Set NULL skip exports.

title: Spectral processing using spectral binning — tar_spectral_binning
text: list target objects processing mzML data files using spectral binning.

title: Spectral processing using spectral binning — tar_spectral_binning
text: Specifying arguments mzML sample_info NULL enables use one data file sample information one input target factories, tar_input_file_path(), tar_input_grover() tar_input_piggyback(). See example using tar_input_piggyback() .

title: Spectral processing using spectral binning — tar_spectral_binning
code: if (FALSE) { ## Perform spectral binning by specifying the file paths and sample information directly targets::tar_dir({     targets::tar_script({         library(hrmtargets)         file_paths <- metaboData::filePaths('FIE-HRMS','UrineTechnical',                                             ask = FALSE)         sample_info <- metaboData::runinfo('FIE-HRMS','UrineTechnical',                                            ask = FALSE)                  list(             tar_spectral_binning(example,                                  mzML = file_paths,                                  sample_info = sample_info)         )     })     targets::tar_make()     targets::tar_read(example_results_spectral_processing)     targets::tar_read(example_plot_fingerprint) })  ## Perform spectral binning by using tar_input_piggyback()  targets::tar_dir({     targets::tar_script({         library(hrmtargets)         name <- rlang::expr(example)                  list(             tar_input_piggyback(!!name,                                 'FIE-HRMS_BdistachyonTechnical',                                 repo = 'jasenfinch/metaboData'),             tar_spectral_binning(!!name)         )     })     targets::tar_make()     targets::tar_read(example_results_spectral_processing)     targets::tar_read(example_plot_fingerprint) }) }

title: Spectral processing — tar_spectral_processing
text: Targets spectral processing.

title: Spectral processing — tar_spectral_processing
code: tar_spectral_processing(   name,   type = c("FIE-HRMS", "RP-LC-HRMS", "NP-LC-HRMS"),   ... )

title: Spectral processing — tar_spectral_processing
text: name Symbol. name collection targets. serves prefix target names. type type analytical technique. ... Arguments pass relevant target factory. See details.

title: Spectral processing — tar_spectral_processing
text: list target objects spectral processing specified technique.

title: Spectral processing — tar_spectral_processing
text: Technique FIE-HRMS return targets using tar_spectral_binning(). Techniques RP-LC-HRMS NP-LC-HRMS return targets using tar_profiling().

title: Spectral processing — tar_spectral_processing
code: if (FALSE) { ## Perform spectral processing using technique `FIE-HRMS`  targets::tar_dir({     targets::tar_script({         library(hrmtargets)         name <- rlang::expr(example)                  list(             tar_input_piggyback(!!name,                                 'FIE-HRMS_BdistachyonTechnical',                                 repo = 'jasenfinch/metaboData'),             tar_spectral_processing(!!name,                                     type = 'FIE-HRMS')         )     })     targets::tar_make()     targets::tar_read(example_results_spectral_processing)     targets::tar_read(example_plot_fingerprint) }) }

title: hrmtargets 0.1.0
text: Initial release Added NEWS.md file track changes package.
